Name: idea_generation_methods
Title: Idea Generation Methods: Comparing different idea generation methods for automated research paper generation.
Experiment: In this experiment, we compare the performance of different idea generation methods (perform_generate_idea()) on automated research paper generation performance. We use the review score by (perform_review()) as the evaluation metric.

Name: divergent_convergent_thinking
Title: Integrating Divergent and Convergent Thinking for Enhanced Idea Generation in AI Research
Experiment: Implement a divergent thinking phase utilizing brainstorming techniques and heuristics to generate a wide range of ideas. Follow with a convergent thinking phase using structured evaluation metrics and multi-criteria decision analysis (MCDA) to refine and select the best ideas. Modify the generate_ideas function to include these new phases and criteria for selection. Compare the effectiveness of this approach with the current method by analyzing the novelty, significance, and overall quality of the generated ideas.

Name: reinforcement_learning_idea_generation
Title: Optimizing Idea Generation in AI Research with Reinforcement Learning
Experiment: Implement a simplified reinforcement learning framework to dynamically select from a limited set of idea generation strategies. Use a predefined dataset of idea quality metrics for initial training. Define a reward function based on the novelty, feasibility, interestingness, and significance of the ideas. Modify the generate_ideas function to incorporate the RL agent. Compare the performance of the RL-based approach with current methods by analyzing the quality of the generated ideas.

Name: collaborative_filtering_idea_generation
Title: Enhancing Idea Generation in AI Research with Collaborative Filtering Techniques
Experiment: Implement a collaborative filtering system to analyze a database of past ideas based on their attributes (novelty, significance, interestingness, and feasibility). Preprocess the data to normalize scores and handle missing values. Use an item-based collaborative filtering algorithm to recommend new research ideas that align with successful trends identified in the database. Validate the recommendations against expert judgment or historical success rates. Modify the generate_ideas function to incorporate collaborative filtering and the validation step. Compare the effectiveness of this approach with current methods by analyzing the novelty, significance, and overall quality of the generated ideas.

Name: meta_learning_idea_generation
Title: Enhancing Idea Generation in AI Research with Meta-Learning
Experiment: 1. Create a dataset of past generated ideas, including their attributes (novelty, significance, interestingness, feasibility) and evaluation scores. 2. Implement a model-agnostic meta-learning (MAML) algorithm that uses this dataset to predict the optimal parameters for generating new ideas. 3. Modify the generate_ideas function to incorporate the MAML model and dynamically adjust the idea generation process based on feedback from previous ideas. 4. Establish a feedback loop where the generated ideas are evaluated, and the evaluation scores are used to update the meta-learning model. 5. Compare the effectiveness of this meta-learning-based approach with current methods by analyzing the novelty, significance, and overall quality of the generated ideas.

Name: knowledge_graph_idea_generation
Title: Enhancing Idea Generation in AI Research with Knowledge Graphs
Experiment: 1. Construct a knowledge graph from existing literature in a specific subdomain of AI research (e.g., natural language processing), capturing key concepts, methods, and their interrelationships. 2. Integrate the knowledge graph into the generate_ideas function to guide the generation process. 3. Modify the generate_ideas function to utilize the knowledge graph for contextual and relevant idea generation within the chosen subdomain. 4. Compare the effectiveness of this knowledge graph-based approach with current methods by analyzing the novelty, significance, and overall quality of the generated ideas.

Name: explainable_idea_generation
Title: Enhancing Idea Generation in AI Research with Explainability Techniques
Experiment: 1. Integrate explainability techniques (e.g., SHAP, LIME) into the generate_ideas function to analyze the generated ideas. 2. Use the insights from the explainability analysis to refine the generated ideas iteratively. 3. Modify the generate_ideas function to incorporate feedback from the explainability analysis to iteratively improve the idea generation process. 4. Compare the effectiveness of this explainability-based approach with current methods by analyzing the novelty, significance, and overall quality of the generated ideas.

Name: human_in_the_loop
Title: Integrating Human Feedback for Enhanced AI-Driven Idea Generation
Experiment: 1. Develop a simple web-based user interface where researchers can view and rate generated ideas on a scale of 1-10 for novelty, feasibility, and significance. 2. Modify the generate_ideas function to accept these ratings and use a weighted averaging method to prioritize the highest-rated ideas in subsequent iterations. 3. Implement a basic feedback loop where the ratings directly influence the parameters for the next round of idea generation, simplifying the use of reinforcement learning for initial implementation. 4. Compare the effectiveness of this human-in-the-loop approach with current methods by analyzing the novelty, significance, and overall quality of the generated ideas.

Name: multi_modal_idea_generation
Title: Enhancing Idea Generation in AI Research with Multi-Modal Data
Experiment: 1. Implement a multi-modal data processing pipeline that can handle text and images. 2. Integrate this pipeline into the generate_ideas function. 3. Modify the generate_ideas function to utilize the multi-modal data for generating ideas. 4. Compare the effectiveness of this multi-modal approach with current methods by analyzing the novelty, significance, and overall quality of the generated ideas.

Name: transfer_learning_idea_generation
Title: Enhancing Idea Generation in AI Research with Transfer Learning
Experiment: 1. Identify pre-trained models from related domains that can be fine-tuned for our idea generation task. 2. Modify the generate_ideas function to incorporate transfer learning techniques, including loading pre-trained models and fine-tuning them on our dataset. 3. Evaluate the generated ideas using the same metrics (novelty, significance, interestingness, feasibility) and compare the results with the current methods. 4. Analyze the impact of transfer learning on the quality and diversity of the generated ideas.

Name: collaborative_swarm_intelligence
Title: Enhancing Idea Generation with Real-Time Collaborative Swarm Intelligence
Experiment: 1. Develop a framework where multiple AI agents can collaborate in real-time to generate ideas. This includes setting up a shared workspace and communication protocols. 2. Modify the generate_ideas function to orchestrate the collaboration, enabling agents to share intermediate results and refine ideas iteratively. 3. Implement synchronization mechanisms to ensure seamless collaboration and avoid conflicts, such as using a version control system or a decentralized approach. 4. Introduce a scoring system to evaluate the contributions of individual agents and optimize the collective performance through reinforcement learning. 5. Compare the effectiveness of this collaborative swarm intelligence approach with current methods by analyzing the novelty, significance, and overall quality of the generated ideas.
